newsitem.title: USA: Alamco to merge with Columbia Gas unit.
newsitem.headline: Alamco to merge with Columbia Gas unit.

text.p: Alamco Inc said Tuesday it agreed to be acquired by Columbia Gas System Inc for about $101 million.
Alamco said its stockholders would receive $15.75 cash per share on a fully diluted basis and the company would merge with Columbia Natural Resources Inc, a wholly owned unit of Columbia Gas.
Alamco said it has about 5.2 million shares outstanding on a fully-diluted basis.
Alamco said the $101 million purchase price also includes the assumption of outstanding bank debt. Columbia Gas, in a separate statement, put the amount of debt involved in the deal at $18 million.
Alamco said the merger is subject a majority affirmative vote from holders of its outstanding common shares. It has scheduled a special meeting of shareholders for August 7.
Alamco, headquartered in Clarksburg, West Virginia, is an independent producer of natural gas and oil.
